DOC.brief_summary: The present study design investigate whether thrombus aspiration use Export Aspiration Catheter ( Medtronic Corporation , California , USA ) primary percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) acute myocardial infarction improve clinical outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Thrombosuction Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention Acute Myocardial Infarction
DOC.detailed_description: Primary percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) prefer strategy immediate revascularization patient acute ST-elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) . A meta-analysis trial compare primary PCI fibrinolytic therapy show mortality benefit invasive approach . However , although TIMI III flow achieve culprit epicardial vessel majority patient , lack tissue-level reperfusion observe approximately 30 % patient manifest persistence chest pain ST-segment elevation . Many strategy try overcome problem , mechanical thrombectomy distal protection device myocardial preserve agent . The purpose present study investigate efficacy thrombus aspiration use Export Aspiration Catheter ( Medtronic Corporation , California , USA ) primary PCI acute myocardial infarction .
DOC.criteria: Patients first STelevation myocardial infarction undergo primary PCI within 12 hour symptom onset Patients eligible PCI Exclusion criterion History bleed diathesis coagulopathy Pregnant Known hypersensitivity contraindication contrast agent Left main disease Instent restenosis lesion Graft vessel lesion Chronic total occlusion lesion Renal dysfunction , creatinine 2.0 mg/dL Contraindication aspirin , clopidogrel cilostazol Prior PCI bypass surgery Old myocardial infarction
